hyper slice

Extract the raw array data for the active grid, as a list of arrays. This can be the entire array/s or after dimension-slicing using hyper_filter expressions.

hyper_slice(x, select_var = NULL, ..., raw_datavals = FALSE,
  force = FALSE)

# S3 method for tidync
hyper_slice(x, select_var = NULL, ...,
  raw_datavals = FALSE, force = FALSE)

# S3 method for character
hyper_slice(x, ..., select_var = NULL,
  raw_datavals = FALSE)

Arguments

x

tidync object
select_var

optional vector of variable names to select
...

ignored
raw_datavals

logical to control whether scaling in the NetCDF is applied or not
force

ignore caveats about large extraction and just do it

Details

By default all variables in the active grid are returned, use select_var to limit.

Examples

f <- "S20080012008031.L3m_MO_CHL_chlor_a_9km.nc"
l3file <- system.file("extdata/oceandata", f, package= "tidync")

## extract a raw list by filtered dimension
araw <- tidync(l3file) %>% hyper_filter(lat = abs(lat) < 10, lon = index < 100) %>%
  hyper_slice()
## hyper_slice will pass the expressions to hyper_filter
braw <- tidync(l3file) %>% hyper_slice(lat = abs(lat) < 10, lon = index < 100)
